Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Angels look to stop a three-game slide when they take on the Houston Astros.
The Astros are up 4-3 in the season series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The teams meet Saturday for the eighth time this season.
Zachary Neto leads the Angels with a.254 batting average, and has 31 doubles, a triple, 21 home runs, 36 walks and 71 RBI.
Taylor Ward is 12-for-37 with four home runs and six RBI over the last 10 games.
Yordan Alvarez has 31 doubles, two triples and 33 home runs for the Astros.
Jose Altuve is 15-for-40 with four doubles, a home run and six RBI over the past 10 games.
Others: Justin Verlander (3-6, 5.30 ERA, 1.38 WHIP, 63 strikeouts) will start for the Astros, while Tyler Anderson (10-12, 3.50 ERA, 1.23 WHIP, 132 strikeouts) will start for the Angels.
